result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven M. Petroski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven M. Petroski is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven M. Petroski was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
10:05am Defendant Steven M. Petroski appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA states case and appearances.  DA states agreement reached by parties.  Court questions DE regarding his right to an Atty.  Court finds DE waiver of attorney to be free, etc.  DE enters plea of no contest to Cnt. 2.   Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty of Cnt 2 and orders entry of judgment.  On motion of DA, Court dismisses Cnt 1.

Cnt 2 
Sentence Withheld, Probation 1 year

Court Costs (243.)
DNA (200.)
DOM (100.)
Enroll and successfully complete the next Batterer's Group
Submit to AODA assessment and comply with any recommendations
DE must submit an apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by probation agent

Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Steven M. Petroski appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE plans to retain an attorney.  Court gives DE another notice of right to atty.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  Bond to continue.
State's - Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  Defendant may not have contact with Candace Kane, unless written consent is filed with the Clerk's office or outside business hours with the Price County Sheriff's Dept.

Defendant Steven M. Petroski appeared, in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges.  DE next court date is 8/30/16  at 10 am.  Court gives DE a notice of right to attorney and victim witness intimidation form.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation.  Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint.
Defendant may not have contact with Candace Kane, unless written consent is filed with the Clerk's office or outside business hours with the Price County Sheriff's Dept.
